Management.concept_text: Executive leadership and company ownership. C-level officers (CEO, CFO, CTO), founders, owners, managing directors, board members, and partners who make strategic decisions and run organizations.

Director.concept_text: Senior department leaders who oversee business functions and report to executives. Directors of sales, marketing, engineering, finance, and other departments. Vice presidents of specific areas.

Lead.concept_text: Team leaders and technical leads who manage groups of professionals. Head of departments, team leads, tech leads, engineering leads, group leaders, and supervisors with direct reports.

Senior.concept_text: Experienced individual contributors with deep expertise. Senior engineers, senior analysts, senior consultants, principal and staff level roles with significant experience but typically no direct reports.

Professional.concept_text: Standard professional roles without seniority modifiers. Regular engineers, analysts, managers, specialists, and coordinators at mid-career level performing core job functions.

Junior.concept_text: Entry-level positions and those starting their careers. Interns, trainees, apprentices, junior roles, graduates, working students, and those in training programs learning the profession.

Information Technology.concept_text: Technology and software development roles. Software engineers, developers, data scientists, DevOps engineers, IT support, system administrators, network engineers, and technical specialists who build and maintain software systems.

Sales.concept_text: Revenue generation and client acquisition. Sales representatives, account executives, account managers, sales managers, and commercial roles focused on selling products and services to customers.

Marketing.concept_text: Brand promotion and market communication. Marketing managers, brand managers, digital marketers, content creators, social media managers, PR professionals, and those driving awareness and engagement.

Human Resources.concept_text: People management and talent acquisition. HR managers, recruiters, talent acquisition specialists, people operations, compensation managers, and training professionals who manage the employee lifecycle.

Consulting.concept_text: Advisory and professional services. Management consultants, strategy consultants, business consultants, IT consultants working at consulting firms providing expert advice to client organizations.

Project Management.concept_text: Project and product coordination. Project managers, program managers, product managers, product owners, scrum masters, and delivery managers who coordinate work and ensure successful delivery.

Business Development.concept_text: Strategic growth and partnerships. Business development managers, partnership managers, alliance managers focused on expansion, new markets, and strategic business relationships.

Customer Support.concept_text: Customer service and technical support. Customer service representatives, support specialists, customer success managers, help desk analysts, and service roles focused on customer satisfaction.

Administrative.concept_text: Office administration and executive support. Office managers, executive assistants, administrative assistants, secretaries, and receptionists who manage office operations and support executives.

Purchasing.concept_text: Procurement and supply chain. Purchasing managers, procurement specialists, buyers, sourcing managers, and supply chain professionals who manage vendor relationships and purchasing.

Other.concept_text: Roles that do not fit into specific departments above. Includes finance, accounting, legal, medical, education, research, operations, and general management roles not covered by other categories.
